nodes.bodyText: We don't need this new feature. The reason is, you can toleration servlet-5.0 in the existing com.ibm.websphere.appserver.auditCollector-1.0 feature.
Remove the auditCollector-1.0 feature. We will leave it in the public feature.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,16 @@
+-include= ~${workspace}/cnf/resources/bnd/feature.props
+
+symbolicName = io.openliberty.audit-1.0.javaee
+visibility = private
+
+IBM-Provision-Capability: osgi.identity; filter:="(&(type=osgi.subsystem.feature)(osgi.identity=com.ibm.websphere.appserver.audit-1.0))",\
+  osgi.identity; filter:="(&(type=osgi.subsystem.feature)(|(osgi.identity=com.ibm.websphere.appserver.servlet-3.0)(osgi.identity=com.ibm.websphere.appserver.servlet-3.1)(osgi.identity=com.ibm.websphere.appserver.servlet-4.0)))"
+
+IBM-Install-Policy: when-satisfied
+
+-features=\
+  com.ibm.websphere.appserver.appSecurity-2.0; ibm.tolerates:="3.0", \
+  com.ibm.websphere.appserver.auditCollector-1.0

nodes.bodyText: It is also possible that you may need to put a dependency on the servlet-3.0 feature (tolerating 3.1 and 4.0).

Done

Tolerate servlet-5.0.
com.ibm.websphere.appserver.servlet-3.0; ibm.tolerates:="3.1,4.0,5.0"

+

+  io.openliberty.auditCollector-1.0
+
+kind=noship
+edition=core

nodes.bodyText: This filter doesn't make any sense.  Just move the bundles from this auto feature to the audit1.0.jakarta auto feature.
This filter doesn't make any sense.  Just move the bundles from this auto feature to the audit1.0.javaee auto feature.

This protected feature which is really an auto feature doesn't make any sense.  audit already depends on servlet and appSecurity.  As such this file should be deleted and the requestProbes dependency should just be added to audit-1.0 feature.
